question: In the reaction between moist <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> and acidified permanganate solution : [cite: 229]
choices: <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$SO_{4}^{2-}$</katex>; <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is reduced to S; <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$MnO_{4}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$SO_{3}^{2}$</katex>; <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$MnO_{2}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$H_{2}S$</katex>; <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$MnO_{4}$</katex>
explanation: <katex>$SO_2$</katex> acts as a reducing agent and is oxidised to sulphate (<katex>$SO_4^{2-}$</katex>), while Permanganate (<katex>$MnO_4^-$</katex>) acts as an oxidising agent and is reduced to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex> in acidic medium. [cite: 230, 234]
